title: torch.topk _demands_ a dimension if `largest` is specified
body_html:
Hi..

I think this is a bug:

data = torch.randn(5,10)
srtd, indices = torch.sort(data) # This is fine.

srtd, indices = torch.sort(data, 1, descending=False) # This is also fine.
srtd, indices = torch.sort(data, 1, descending=True) # This is also fine.

# But, these both fail:
srtd, indices = torch.sort(data, descending=False) # This fails
srtd, indices = torch.sort(data, descending=True) # This fails

So, it doesn't matter if descending is True or False, just specifying it explicitly requires dimension to be specified.. It would be better (I think) if descending could be specified alone..

body:
Hi..

I think this is a bug:

```
data = torch.randn(5,10)
srtd, indices = torch.sort(data) # This is fine.

srtd, indices = torch.sort(data, 1, descending=False) # This is also fine.
srtd, indices = torch.sort(data, 1, descending=True) # This is also fine.

# But, these both fail:
srtd, indices = torch.sort(data, descending=False) # This fails
srtd, indices = torch.sort(data, descending=True) # This fails
```

So, it doesn't matter if descending is True _or_ False, just specifying it explicitly _requires_ dimension to be specified.. It would be better (I think) if descending could be specified alone..
